name: places/ChIJO84BlrJZwokR7APe7KNemTM
formattedAddress: 422 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 422 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chain retailer of air & water purifiers, floor & central vacuum systems, plus allergy control items.

originalText.text:
TL, DR: Just say no! And go elsewhere.

They took seven months to fix my vacuum. They did not call, or update, or make any effort to let me know when it would be ready.

When it was finally repaired, the guy handed me a machine that was four different colors. Plus the cost was more than originally quoted. The guy claimed it was just the tax and that it's illegal to quote the price with tax in NY. Oh? They couldn't say the price is X plus Y tax equals Z????  I complained about the price and the way it all looked. That was only the beginning.

He wouldn't let me have the vacuum back! I showed him my card, but he wouldn't take it.

He said he would take the vacuum back to the shop. Then he said he would call the police!

I am a small woman. He was a medium-large man. We shouted and tussled over the thing.  It was so bad a woman passing by took her phone out to record it all.

When I later complained to consumer affairs, the store claimed I had refused to pay (a lie), and that I was somehow threatening him!

These jerks have no business interacting with the public or being in business.

The single star is only because Google wouldn't allow zero.

originalText.text: Repairing our nice, old vacuum cleaner took this upper east side shop 6 months. After the vacuum was dropped off, in June 2019, the shopkeeper said he would call to let us know the estimate. He never called. In July I called, gave him my number, the order receipt number, etc. — he never called. I called: August, September, October. Finally, finally the estimate was for $100dollars plus would I like to buy a new vacuum bag. By November the vacuum was fixed. I strongly recommend not working with this place. Which is a shame, because the person who fixed the vacuum did a good job. It’s the shopkeeper’s horrible lack of skills, impolite, gruff, an irresponsible worker. The amount of times I gave my phone number and order receipt no. — it’s a sign things are truly falling apart. Go somewhere else. When I find that place I’ll report back. To the repair person, thank you for fixing my vacuum.
